channel.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India
channel.description: World News: TOI brings the latest world news headlines, Current International breaking news world wide. In depth analysis and top news headlines world wide.

image.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India

item.title: Is Kamala Harris a 'communist'? What Elon Musk said
item.description: Elon Musk called US presidential contender Kamala Harris a 'communist' for her stance on equitable distribution. Musk's remark came in response to a post highlighting Harris's support for equitable outcomes. Musk previously endorsed Donald Trump and clarified misinformation about his financial contributions to Trump's campaign, denying donations of $45 million per month.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Akasa @2: ‘Will be among world’s top 30 airlines by end of decade,’ says Vinay Dube
item.description: ​​ Despite facing uncertainty over aircraft deliveries from embattled Boeing, Dube assured employees that “we are poised to grow faster than many thought possible” and that Akasa is the “only Indian airline in history to reach a firm book order of this size (226 MAX) within 17 months of commencing operations…. Laying the foundation for unprecedented growth.”
item.dc:creator: Saurabh Sinha

item.title: Nearly 40,000 and counting: The struggle to keep track of Gaza deaths
Bangladesh crisis: Was Sheikh Hasina ousted in a coup orchestrated by army chief Waker-Uz-Zaman?
item.description: Bangladesh's army chief, Waker-Uz-Zaman, directed his officers not to fire on protestors enforcing Sheikh Hasina's curfew, resulting in her losing military support. "Hasina no longer had the army's support," an Indian official familiar with the situation said.​​ Following deadly clashes, Hasina fled the country and resigned. Nobel laureate Muhammad Yunus is set to return to lead an interim government amid ongoing unrest.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Thai court dissolves progressive Move Forward Party, which won election but failed to take power
item.description: The Constitutional Court said it voted unanimously to dissolve the party because its campaign to amend the law was considered an attempt to overthrow the nation's constitutional monarchy.

item.title: Peta protesters interrupt Pope Francis' Vatican audience, call on him to denounce bullfighting
item.description: During Pope Francis' general audience, two Peta activists interrupted the event with banners and t-shirts protesting bullfighting, calling it a sin. Peta has urged the Pope to sever the Catholic Church's association with bullfighting. The Vatican has yet to comment, but such protests have led to mounting criticism of the blood sport linked to Catholic traditions.

item.title: Turkey to submit request to join genocide case against Israel in UN court
item.description: The declaration of intervention will be submitted at the International Court of Justice in The Hague, the official said on condition of anonymity in line with regulations that bar officials from speaking to the media without prior authorization

item.title: Tim Walz: From LGBTQ+ rights to military reform, how Harris' new running mate stands out
item.description: Tim Walz was chosen as Kamala Harris' running mate for the Democratic presidential ticket after Joe Biden opted out of re-election. Walz, Minnesota’s governor, has been a staunch advocate for LGBTQ+ rights, signing laws against conversion therapy and protecting trans youth. His advocacy work extends back to supporting same-sex marriage and repealing "Don’t Ask, Don’t Tell."
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Trump makes bizarre prediction: Rants about Biden crashing DNC and challenges him to debate
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Priscilla Chan bakes ‘knee day’ cake for Mark Zuckerberg, Meta CEO responds
item.description: Mark Zuckerberg shared a heartwarming moment on Instagram after his wife, Priscilla Chan, celebrated his successful nine-month ACL rehab with a special cake. Chan posted a witty message and a photo of a knee-shaped cake, to which Zuckerberg responded with emojis, expressing his gratitude. The post quickly went viral, garnering widespread appreciation from followers.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Rajapaksas officially ditch Wickremesinghe, youngest heir announced as candidate for Lanka presidency
NYC turns to drones for flood warnings in vulnerable neighborhoods
item.description: New York City officials used drones with loudspeakers to warn residents of potential flooding. The initiative, launched due to increasing weather-related threats, targets those in vulnerable areas like basement apartments. The warnings are given in multiple languages, complementing other alert systems like social media and text notifications. The focus is on safety and preparedness during severe rainstorms.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Confident that resilient spirit ...': Pakistan expresses solidarity with violence-hit Bangladesh
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: China urges officials to stop playing ‘throwing eggs’ card game
item.description: China urged officials to halt playing the popular guandan poker game, arguing it distracted from work responsibilities. Beijing Youth Daily highlighted how the game became a socializing tool among businesspeople and officials, affecting productivity. President Xi Jinping expressed frustration over difficulties in motivating lower-level officials to follow his policies and act decisively in critical situations.

item.title: From classroom to Capitol: Gwen's impact on Tim Walz's governance
item.description: Minnesota Governor Tim Walz, a former high school teacher, deeply valued education, which led him and his wife, Gwen, on a lifelong journey in teaching and advocacy. The First Lady's initiatives in prison reform and education reflect their shared values. Their family life includes two children and a keen interest in pet rescues.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Nasa forced to delay SpaceX mission: What’s going wrong with Starliner?
item.description: Nasa delayed SpaceX Crew-9 mission to the ISS due to problems with Boeing's Starliner spacecraft. The Starliner, which transported two astronauts to the ISS in June, has been docked for two months due to propulsion anomalies. Now set for September 24, the Crew-9 mission may return the stranded astronauts and two Crew-8 members as Boeing addresses its issues. Updates are expected on Wednesday.
item.dc:creator: TOI Science Desk

item.title: Tropical storm Debby: Community rallies with ice, water, and food distribution post-storm
item.description: Columbia County residents received crucial relief supplies like ice, water, and food at local community centers following Tropical Storm Debby. Volunteers assisted in distribution, ensuring support for those without electricity. Community members were urged to check on neighbors, especially the elderly. Updates on distribution continued via social media and dedicated hotlines.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'I’m a childless cat lady': Harris supporter captures attention at Philadelphia rally as costume goes viral
item.description: Kamala Harris announced Minnesota Governor Tim Walz as her vice-presidential running mate at a rally in Philadelphia, which included a viral moment with a supporter in a cat costume. Harris emphasized their shared middle-class backgrounds and vision for America. Walz expressed his gratitude and commitment to the campaign on social media, promising readiness from day one.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Why Kamala Harris picked Tim Walz for Vice President
item.description: US Vice President Kamala Harris selected Minnesota Governor Tim Walz as her 2024 running mate, bypassing the more politically advantageous Josh Shapiro of Pennsylvania. Walz's plain-spoken style and progressive achievements are aimed at reuniting Democratic blocs and countering Republican policies. His selection seeks to boost the party's focus on economic issues and appeal in battleground states.

item.title: Yahya Sinwar named Hamas leader: What does his appointment mean for Gaza-Israel tensions?
item.description: Hamas announced Yahya Sinwar as its new political leader on Tuesday, following the assassination of Ismail Haniyeh. Sinwar, accused of masterminding the October 7 attack on Israel, is one of Israel's most wanted militants. The Ezzedine Al-Qassam Brigades subsequently fired rockets towards Israel from the Gaza Strip.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk
